benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: Happy-path scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03) verify 201 responses and correct Tag objects.

Invalid Payload and Input Validation: Malformed JSON (TC09), empty body (TC10), invalid tag definition UUID (TC11), extra/unsupported parameters (TC12), and partial inputs (TC24) are rejected with 400 (or 422) as appropriate.
Authorization/Authentication: Tests cover missing required header (TC06) and unauthorized token scenarios (TC16) resulting in 400/401.
Not Found/Bad Request Handling: Invalid invoice item id format (TC07) yields 400; non-existent invoice item (TC08) yields 404.
Duplicate Handling: Duplicate tagDefinitionUuid in request (TC13) is de-duplicated; no duplicate tags created.
Large Payloads/Performance: Tests cover extremely large payloads (TC19) with 201 or 413 depending on size.
Security/Malicious Input: Malicious payload scenario (TC18) yields 400 or 422.
Integration/Dependency Failures: Dependent tag definition service down (TC21) yields 503; KillBill service down (TC17) yields 503 as well.
State Variation: DB state variations (TC22, TC23) and maximum allowed tags (TC23) scenarios.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling for large datasets (likely not applicable to this POST endpoint but relevant for list endpoints).
Rate Limiting: No tests cover rate limiting/throttling for rapid successive POST requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests cover caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) for this endpoint.
403 Forbidden: No tests explicitly verify access forbidden scenarios beyond the 401/400 cases.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests to validate throttling and graceful degradation under high load.
Add caching tests to verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, and cache invalidation semantics after POST.
Add explicit 403 Forbidden tests to cover authorization beyond missing tokens.
Add pagination tests if the API surface expands to support listing or retrieving tags across multiple invoice items.
